column5: Made the annual trek down to Windsor to partake of the silver bass run on the river. We had a crew of 3 this time, Drove through some wicked storms out by Chatham and got rained on all day.  Some parts of the river were just shoulder to shoulder. Sort of reminded me of the good old days of opener on the Ganny. Regardless of all that the fishing was great. Lots of big silvers this spring. By noon the arm felt like it was going to drop off. Mo walleye this time though.
Sounds like a great day in spite of the rain! I'd like to see some pics!
! I'd like to see some pics! Photobucket is no longer user friendly,and Picasa has beeb d/c'd
usually it's 2 Americans to 1 Canadian -they love their silver bass ! Glad you had fun
This Canadian doesn't even know what a silver bass is...but I bet thos L St C muskies sure do!

Was just there today for some eyes. We ended up with with more silver bass but it was still an alright day, winds really picked up this afternoon. I've never seen so many people shoulder to shoulder on shore with containers waiting to fillem up.
